snippet: Jorge Rafael Videla, who led the military during much of Argentina’s dictatorship, and Reynaldo Bignone, Argentina’s last dictator, were both sentenced to prison.
abstract: Jorge Rafael Videla, who led the military during much of Argentina’s dictatorship, is convicted and sentenced to 50 years in prison for executing a systematic plan to steal babies from prisoners during the military junta’s war on leftist dissenters three decades ago; Argentina’s last military dictator, Reynaldo Bignone, is also convicted and receives a 15-year sentence.
lead_paragraph: Jorge Rafael Videla, who led the military during much of Argentina’s dictatorship, and Reynaldo Bignone, Argentina’s last dictator, were both sentenced to prison.

headline.main: Argentina: Ex-Dictators Are Convicted of Arranging to Steal Dissidents’ Babies
headline.print_headline: Argentina: Ex-Dictators Are Convicted Of Arranging to Steal Dissidents’ Babies

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
